name: Apple Tree
description: Look for a small to medium-sized tree with gnarled branches, glossy green leaves, and clusters of pink or white blossoms in spring—later bearing round, crisp fruits in shades of red, green, or yellow. The bark is often rough and flaky, and you might spot fallen apples or their sweet scent on the ground in autumn.

name: Maple Tree
description: Look for broad, lobed leaves with pointed tips that turn fiery red or gold in autumn, and check for winged "helicopter" seeds twirling to the ground in summer. Its smooth gray bark darkens and cracks with age.

name: Pine Tree
description: Tall and straight with rough, scaly bark, its long needles grow in clusters and release a sharp, resinous scent when crushed—spot its distinctive cones scattered below.
